text: An Argentine soldier returning from the Falkland Islands at the end of the war called his mother from the I Regiment of Palermo in Buenos Aires and asked for permission to take home a mutilated companion whose family lived elsewhere. It was, he said, a 19-year-old recruit who had lost a leg and an arm in the war, and who was also blind. The mother, though happy to see her son return alive, replied horrified that she would not be able to bear the sight of the mutilated, and refused to accept him into her home. Then the son cut off communication and shot himself. FIN
title: El soldado mutilado
author: Gabriel García Márquez
